intro: Cardiospermum corindum f. brachycarpum, commonly known as the short-carpel heartseed. It is a variant of the heartseed plant, characterized by its smaller, more compact fruits compared to the typical form. This plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy, pink to red flowers that attract pollinators. The fruit, while small, contains seeds that are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture.
